intro: Lasiosiphon linifolius var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy leaf lasiosiphon, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine pubescence, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
